ratings.comment: The most amazing teacher I've ever had. I'm usually bad at keeping up with readings, but he's so caring and has such interesting insights that I wanted to keep up. He's so passionate and brings his personal perspective into class, while making us feel comfortable to share our own takeaways. He made an impact on my life.
super chill dude. Exams were all blue book and pretty straightforward. A lot of reading, but it was all interesting so nbd.

Goodkin was a great professor! Definitely take his classes. He cares about his students a lot and wants to help everyone learn. He really leads you in the right direction based on what he wants you to get out of the readings.

M. Goodkin was a good professor. The class was fairly easy as we only had to watch movies, participate, & write 3 papers. He's very passionate about what he teaches & is very open to have discussions about are opinions on the movies. Just a heads up tho, the essays will take you much longer than he says, so start early.
I was a student of Professor Goodkin at Yale College in the late 1980s. He was, by far, the best professor I had at Yale. Merci M. Goodkin. Catherine Marquet Elliott Yale 1987 Linguistics

Prof Goodkin is one of my favorite french professors I've ever had. He structures the class really well, and we do careful analyses of the readings (in small groups and as a larger class). Although there is a decent amount of reading, it is manageable. He is a really kind and caring person (super funny too)!!!

The nicest professor I have had in college. I had him for a few semesters and he made the class very engaging. I had him when COVID hit and we had to go home. He adapted to the change of learning so well and he was so kind to us as students. TAKE HIM!! He has been an influential person in my experience at UW.

Prof. Goodkin is one of the best professors on this campus. He makes French lit accessible and inclusive, and picks new books to read each semester. The essays are a lot of work but it is very worth it. He puts a lot of care into his classes - he's a real gem. I took 3 classes with him and my French improved so much!

Easy one of the nicest Profs ever. Not only made literature, a subject I hate, extremely fun, enjoyable, and understandable, but did it in a language I've only spoken around 5 years or so. They're aren't enough kind words to give this man, easily one of the nicest people I've met.

Out of all the professors I've had at UW-Madison, Professor Goodkin may be my favorite. It's clear that he puts a lot of effort and care into his class, and he really cares about each of his students. He makes the classroom feel like an inclusive and comfortable learning space which is awesome to have for any language class. I definitely recommend!
Solid
Great professor. Not the easiest class, but definitely one of the more interesting literature/comm B classes on campus.

Professor Goodkin is my favorite instructor on campus and possibly ever. He genuinely cares about his students and immediately learns everyone's names. He is incredibly knowledgeable, kind, and just a beautiful person. It's a lit class, so there's a lot of reading, but the books are fantastic and meaningful. I wish I could learn more from him.

Never met a professor who cares more about his students. Not only does he make the classroom feel like a safe place to be immersed in a foreign language, but he also challenges his students to think about the selected texts in interesting ways (he cares about the books so much). a real gem

Richard Goodkin is a gem. One of my favorite professors in the UW Madison French department. There is a lot of reading and he requires a lot of participation (he will call you out by name to answer questions) but he is a total sweetheart. His tests are easy: open book and open notes, and he doesn't grade on grammar, just ideas. Class was an easy A.

There is a lot of reading for this class (about 8 books), but I really enjoyed it! On the first day of class, Professor Goodkin had memorized the names of every person in my 50 some student lecture. He really cares about his students and makes sure that his lectures are engaging. He understands that his students have other priorities too.

I knew nothing of French literature before taking this class. I sadly did not particularly like academic reading. Prof. Goodkin is one of the best professors I've had the UW and in my college career. His understanding of course material is unbelievable and his enthusiasm towards teaching and helping his students progress is excellent.

One of the kindest, most caring professors I have ever had. I asked him for some help studying for the final and he gave me a whole paragraph of analysis on the book we would be writing about. Super accessible during office hours, very caring, but can definitely be bit of a tough grader, since he makes you dig deep when analyzing books.
He is incredibly insightful and fair . He is open minded and cares about his students answers.

Professor Goodkin is without a doubt the best professor I've ever had. I feel so lucky to have taken this course! The lectures are insightful and challenges you in a way that, instead of stressing you out, makes you want to learn more. He's also a very fair grader, gives great feedback, and is always available for help. Don't miss this class!

Truly the greatest professor I have ever had! Dr. Goodkin is not only wildly intelligent and interesting to listen to, but he cares so much about his students' success. The books you read are amazing (and I am NOT a literature buff). He gave the greatest feedback on papers, was always available after class, and is simply the sweetest man. 3 RG

He is such a great teacher! Sometimes his classes can get a bit long if they are power lectures. Still even if he just talks the whole time, it is all very relevant. He goes into great depth in analysis of the works you study, which is really helpful come time to write papers. He is always available outside of class if extra help is needed as well!
Professor Goodkin is absolutely wonderful. He knows his stuff and is funny as hell. Grading is fair and the class time is well spent. He is very approachable.
One of the best professors I have ever had :) I enjoyed every class! He keeps students engaged and interested, and is so kind!
Prof. Goodkin is the best professor of French Literature I've ever had. Very endearing, wonderful classes, great reads... A semester to be remembered!
Incredible professor. Packs a ton into every class, and you must prepare for them. Very fair grader. His course taught me so much.
Cosby sweaters on a man who could play the lead in any Molière play.
Goodkin is the best teacher I've ever had on campus (and I've been here 4 years)  He does not bother with plot summaries, he is very good at analysis and leading good discussions.

I was not sure what to expect in this class, but I am so glad I took it.  There is alot of reading but the material is outstanding, I never would have thought that I would enjoy literature.  He is a very good prof he knows what he is teaching and helps you look at the story from a different perspective.  Loved Dangerous Liaisons what a read!
